title: Apple releases first preview of its long-awaited iPhone AI
content: Apple on Monday released the first version of Apple Intelligence.
summary: Apple on Monday released the first version of Apple Intelligence.

title: Temu and Shein's soaring popularity has Wall Street eyeing China's influence on tech earnings
content: Though they're not based in the U.S., Temu and Shein have captured the attention of Wall Street because of their potential impact on U.S. tech companies.
summary: Though they're not based in the U.S., Temu and Shein have captured the attention of Wall Street because of their potential impact on U.S. tech companies.

title: UK finance chief says public finances show $28 billion spending hole, cuts road and rail projects
content: Britain's Finance Minister Rachel Reeves warned "difficult decisions" were still to come on spending, welfare and tax.
summary: Britain's Finance Minister Rachel Reeves warned "difficult decisions" were still to come on spending, welfare and tax.

title: French telecoms network hit by vandalism within days of arson attacks against national railways
content: Damage to French telecoms infrastructure was reported by officials early Monday, causing local power outages.
summary: Damage to French telecoms infrastructure was reported by officials early Monday, causing local power outages.

title: Ford, GM, Stellantis face a daunting second half of 2024
content: The U.S. market – a profit engine for most automakers – is normalizing after years of record high prices, low vehicle inventories and resilient demand.
summary: The U.S. market – a profit engine for most automakers – is normalizing after years of record high prices, low vehicle inventories and resilient demand.

title: Bitcoin reverses lower as investors digest Trump crypto comments and look ahead to central bank meetings
content: Cryptocurrencies slipped to begin the final week of July following Trump's big bitcoin speech and ahead of the Fed meeting.
summary: Cryptocurrencies slipped to begin the final week of July following Trump's big bitcoin speech and ahead of the Fed meeting.

title: How the EV boom led Chinese companies to take over Indonesia’s nickel industry
content: Indonesia leads global nickel production for EV batteries with Chinese investment post-export ban, impacting prices and sustainability concerns.
summary: Indonesia leads global nickel production for EV batteries with Chinese investment post-export ban, impacting prices and sustainability concerns.

title: AT&T, other phone companies sued over stolen nude images could face liability after court ruling
content: Companies like AT&T and T-Mobile have skirted liability when workers allegedly stole nude images from customer phones, but that may change after a court ruling.
summary: Companies like AT&T and T-Mobile have skirted liability when workers allegedly stole nude images from customer phones, but that may change after a court ruling.

title: Swiss pharma giant Roche to accelerate Wegovy rival drugs after positive trial data
content: Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche said Monday it is accelerating the timeline for its Wegovy rival weight loss drugs following promising early stage trial data.
summary: Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche said Monday it is accelerating the timeline for its Wegovy rival weight loss drugs following promising early stage trial data.

title: Heineken shares fall 10% after first-half profit miss
content: Operting profit showed organic growth of 12.5%, below a company-compiled consensus forecast of 13.2%.
summary: Operting profit showed organic growth of 12.5%, below a company-compiled consensus forecast of 13.2%.

title: McDonald's executives admit diners think prices are too high, say they're working to create value
content: McDonald's executives acknowledged that the company's prices have been high and they are taking a "forensic approach" to evaluating offerings.

title: Biden rolls out plan to overhaul the Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court previously ruled that Donald Trump was immune from criminal prosecution for official acts he did as president.
summary: The Supreme Court previously ruled that Donald Trump was immune from criminal prosecution for official acts he did as president.

title: European markets close lower as earnings season continues, Philips soars 14%
content: European markets closed lower Monday as investors digest U.S. inflation data and look ahead to another busy week of earnings and central bank meetings.
summary: European markets closed lower Monday as investors digest U.S. inflation data and look ahead to another busy week of earnings and central bank meetings.

title: Philips shares jump 15% as second-quarter sales grow despite China weakness
content: Shares of Philips jumped in early deals Monday after the Dutch device maker reported better-than-expected second-quarter earnings.

title: Trump agrees to victim interview as FBI searches for shooter's motive
content: The FBI wants Trump's "perspective" on the attack, in which a shooter fired at the Republican nominee while he was on stage in Pennsylvania.

title: 'Deadpool and Wolverine' snares $205 million domestic opening, highest R-rated debut ever
content: "Deadpool & Wolverine" tallied $205 million in domestic ticket sales during its opening, the highest debut of 2024 and of an R-rated film ever.
summary: "Deadpool & Wolverine" tallied $205 million in domestic ticket sales during its opening, the highest debut of 2024 and of an R-rated film ever.

title: 'Sports tourism' is huge. But the Summer Olympics caused travel to Paris to plummet
content: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.
summary: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.

title: McDonald's earnings, revenue miss estimates as consumer pullback worsens

title: Trump stops short of establishing a bitcoin strategic reserve

title: Fed’s key inflation gauge rose 2.5% in June from a year ago, easing path to rate cut
content: The PCE price index was expected to increase 0.1% in June and 2.5% from a year ago.

title: Warner Bros. Discovery sues NBA to secure media rights awarded to Amazon

title: This biographer exchanged emails with Bernie Madoff from prison for a decade. Here’s what he learned

title: Eurostar cancels quarter of train services ahead of Olympics after arson attacks on French railway

title: Bill Ackman's IPO of Pershing Square closed-end fund is delayed, NYSE says
content: Bill Ackman is delaying the highly scrutinized listing of Pershing Square's U.S. closed-end fund, according to a notice on the NYSE's website.

title: Venezuela’s Maduro bids for a third term in power — as U.S., Brazil warn over need for free election

title: Apple's no longer among top 5 smartphone vendors in China as domestic brands dominate market
content: Apple's smartphone market share in China declined 2% in the second quarter as it faces intensifying rivalry from rivals like Huawei, a Canalys report showed.

title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix to build $6.8 billion chip plant in South Korea
content: SK Hynix's plant will be in the Yongin Semiconductor Cluster where the South Korean government is looking to build a massive complex of chip operations.
